Job Title: Engineer (Intermediate) Mission Engineer

Location: Colorado, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.

Job Description

Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Engineer Intermediate (Mission Engineer) to join our team! In this role you will get to support the Missile Defense Agency's Wargames and Exercises Directorate in the design, testing, and execution of Geographic Combatant Command (GCC) wargames and exercises.

What You'll Be Doing

Performs all event integration based upon requirements from the Mission Director and Event Lead. Support development/integration of the blue force laydown, voice and data communications, specific operational versions or capabilities.Drafts and publishes the network architectural drawings and test plans to ensure the Event architecture meets the requirements defined by the Combatant Command and MDA SMEs. Translates customer requirements into architecture capabilities.Functional director of integration activities defined within the test plan.Assist modeling and simulation development teams in the design and implementation of model behaviors within the simulation architecture. Work products include SV-1, SV-2, Communications diagrams, floor plans, rack elevations, test plans, event reports and problem reports.Coordinates the results of testing; obtains assistance identifying new requirements, problems, and fixes for simulations as a result of the analysis/testing from Chief Engineer.


What Required Skills You'll Bring

A bachelor's degree plus 4 years of recent specialized experienceEligibility to obtain at least a Secret clearance within a reasonable period of timeCurrent Passport. Must be willing to travel up to 30% of the timeExperience working in a fast paced, professional environment with the ability to adjust/react to short notice requirements


What Preferred Skills You'll Bring

Experience with MDASim, EADSIM, Linux OS, PiNT, Operational System Framework (OSF), Open Systems Architecture Sensor Models (OSM) is highly preferred but not required


Minimum Clearance Required To Start

Secret

This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.

Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.

Salary Range

$83,300.00 - $145,800.00

We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.

This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.

Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.

We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
